inn1.comm: Full and on the off stump, Zaheer is on target right away even though he's coming back after a bit of a break, Cook watches the ball carefully and defends it back down the pitch
Once again on the off - from over the stumps - just short of  a driving length, Cook waits on the ball and clips it to the on side, no chance of a run though
This one is dragged in just a touch shorter, and wide outside the off stump, Cook is watchful and leaves it well alone to the keeper
this one is again quite wide outside the off stump, Cook once more leaves it well alone
slightly closer to the stumps this time, still quite full, chopped down but straight to point and there's no chance of a run
closer to the stumps, just short of a length, this one does not go away and instead holds its line, left alone to the keeper. That was close to the stumps but well judged.
wide outside the off stump and once again it's left well alone to the wicketkeeper. Good start that from Zaheer apart from the one wide
RP Singh begins his spell. He's bowling to Matt Prior. Once again it's quite full and outside the ooff and Prior leave is alone

Much better from RP! This one is closer to the off stump and there's just a hint of movement as well, Prior comes forward and pokes at it. The ball slides past the toutside edge and goes through to the keeper
Once bitten, momentarily shy ... Prior leaves this ball well alone to the keeper as it slants away outside the off stump

Prior's back to his normal ways, has a go at this one outside the off stump and misses it by some way as the ball leaves Prior, going away from the right-handed batsman with RP Singh's natural arm action

Another play and a miss! Prior's movign half-heartedly across his crease and having a swat at balls that are slanted away from him. With slips in place this is a dangerous ploy. The ball goes just past the edge to the keeper
And this time Prior is chastened and leaves the ball well alone outside the off stump. Good start from RP Singh, a maiden over. The score stays and 1 for no loss.
pushed off the back foot to backward point, no run there ...
and Cook gets off the mark as this one is eased just wide of the man at midwicket who has to tumble and collect the ball. By the time he does so the batsmen cross for a single
Prior is careful as Zaheer hits a good line and length, a pretty decent start from Zaheer
Once again on chance of a run as Prior blocks. Zaheer is making the batsman play but yet not giving enough width to free arms
Prior is squared-up a touch by this one. The ball bounces a touch extra from a length and the ball catches the outside half of the bat and squirts away down towards point

Crack! Fullish, outside the off, Prior gets right behind the line of the ball and punches very very firmly. That was a checked drive and still booms off what must be a very good bat. The outfield is quick and once the ball has beaten the man at point there's really no chance for the fielder in the deep. Prior will feel much, much better after that. First boundary of the England innings
Full and on the stumps, driven carefully but straight to the man at mid-on

And now Cook comes to the party. A fullish ball from RP  is just a touch too straight. Cook turns the wrists at the last moment and sends the ball racing away through midwicket. That was all timing and the ball races away to the fence
Too full and once again on the pads, Cook glances and misses, the ball goes off the pad and bobs down to the wicketkeeper who dives and half stops, the batsmen scurry a leg-bye
This one is short and rising quickly on the batsman. Played down towards backward point with an angled bat for the single
Now Cook gets it away through the off side and there's three runs for the taking. England building some good momentum here after being kept quiet in the first couple of overs
driven wide of long off
short of a good length and on the off, punched away towards cover
Zaheer now gets one to come in off the pitch, rolling the fingers on the ball, Cook watches the ball late and clips the ball away down to fine-leg
just short of a driving length and on the off stump, Prior gets right behind the ball and plays it back down the pitch to the bowler
fuller and on the off, Prior moves nicely into line and punches the ball back down the ground. The ball goes straight to mid-off and there's no chance of a run
short of a length, on the stumps, coming in with the arm, Cook clips off his toes just wide of mid-on, Munaf Patel half dives and parries the ball away, the batsmen can pick up a comfortable two
and now there' s a misfield from Munaf at mid-on as Cook just strokes the ball to him. Another run ...
driven to mid-on
short of a good length, good bounce and carry, left well alone to the keeper

short of a good length, outside the off, Prior has a nibble and just misses the ball/ The ball swings after passing the bat, in towards the stumps, Dhoni catches and goes up in appeal but that's not out
a little too full and on the stumps, Prior has no trouble with this one. Punches past mid-off for a brace to end the over
Fullish ball on the stumps, Zaheer slanting the ball in towards Cook's toes. Cook watches the ball carefully and defends to off
a touch too straight this time from Zaheer and Cook works the ball to the leg side and hares off for a single
banged in a touch short and decent pace as well. Prior comes half forward but decides to defend watchfully rather than play the big shot. The ball rolls back down the pitch to the bowler
Swing and a miss! Prior is in some trouble here as a ball from Zaheer starts just outside the off stump and bends away. A bit too good that for Prior in the kind of form he is in at the moment
fuller and outside the off, punched away through cover, this time there'll be runs for Prior
short of a good length and on the off, the ball hurries Cook a touch, he jams the bat down as quickly as he can and the ball squirts down towards point
RP  continues. Fullish and on the pads. Prior clips the ball to the leg side and steals a single, getting to the non-striker's end
full and very straight, defended back down the ground to the bowler
another ball that is well directed and just threatening to swing, defended back down the pitch to the bowler

short of a good length and slipping down the leg side, Cook swivels and tries to pull the ball away down the leg side. The ball goes off the thigh pad down to fine-leg. A wayward return from Zaheer lets the batsmen get an extra run
fullish and on the stumps, thumped pretty hard but straight to the man at cover
this time Cook gets the ball away on the leg side, but there's no chance of a run as he finds the fielder at mid-on
short of a good length and on the stumps, Prior walks across his stumps and nudges the ball to the leg side for a single
The first real appeal in a while. Fullish and pretty straight. Played at and missed. Zaheer goes up, asking for the lbw, but it's slipping down leg

Dropped! short one banged in, Cook takes the bait, he plays teh pull, it goes straight to RP Singh at fine-leg who watches the ball carefully into his hands and drops the ball! That's a sitter gone abegging.
single pinched to square-leg to add insult to injury
not too full, not too short, Cook plays it really well though, backing away in his crease a little and chopping the ball hard into the ground. It simply kicks off and runs past point to the boundary!
He begins with a no-ball. Short of a good length and on the stumps, played back down the pitch
short, wide, slow ... and rubbish. It looks like Munaf is striving for pace, but the results just aren't there. Prior waits on that dolly and carts it away over point for a boundary
Much better ball. Decent line and length, something approaching good pace, defended back down the pitch
Another one that just sits up a touch. Prior chooses the leg side this time, pulling over midwicket for an easy couple
short of a good length and outside the off, Prior opens the face of the bat and runs teh ball down towards third-man for a couple
another short one, another pull. Suddenly Prior seems to have gotten a bit confident. Perhaps he's decided to go after Munaf. This one is pulled high and wide of midwicket
short of a good length, outside the off, this is supposedly the McGrath line and length that Munaf bowls well, if occasionally these days, left alone to the keeper
just short of a driving length, cramping Cook up a bit for room, the ball is squeezed away towards mid-on and a quick single is pinched
short of a good length and outside the off, Prior waits and chops the ball down through point for an easy single
short of a good length, on the stumps, the ball doesn't quite get up as much as Cook expects and is beaten on the pull, off the pad to the off side for a leg-bye
Prior picks another easy run off, clipping the ball nicely away through point
And another quick run as the ball goes down leg and Cook gets some bat to it and dabs it away to the leg side
short of a good length, outside the off, cut hard but straight to the man at point, Yuvraj fields and that's the end of the over
short of a good length and on the stumps, defended back down the pitch with a straight bat
on the stumps, the ball wobbles just a touch and Cook tries to play across the line to the leg side, a thin inside edge back onto pad. Stifled shout for the lbw, easily turned down
A bit of width, fairly gentle pace at under 130 kmh, Cook leans into a glorious drive and sends the ball skidding across the turf to the cover fence
Once again nothing much in terms of pace and the perfect width for the batsman to place the ball away through the off side for a single
short of a good length and on the off, punched to the off side
Shot! Width offered and graciously accepted. Prior gets down on one knee and crashes the ball through the point region. Munaf is going to get a bit of tap if he can't stick to a good line and length
RP Singh comes back into the attack in place of Zaheer Khan and begins with a wide down the leg side
just short of a length and outside the off stump, Cook watches the ball onto bat and plays it down to point
short of a driving length and on the off, much better from RP, punched back down the ground towards off

And another wide. A run stolen as well. Pretty shabby stuff this from RP. He bangs the bouncer in but it's well down the leg side. Then Dhoni collects and rolls the ball back towards the stumps as the batsmen get the extra run
fullish and outside the off, played away through third-man
short of a length and outside the off, chopped hard down to cover
short and outside the off, this one really sits up and begs to be hit. Cook walks across nicely and pulls in front of square for yet another boundary
And Cook tries to repeat the shot. Except he can't quite get hold of it and the ball goes off the inside edge to the leg side. Good over that from England as RP was all over the place
short of a good length and outside the off, dabbed down to cover for yet another easy single taken
fullish and outside the off, Prior drives hard but straight  to the man at cover
Munaf bangs another one in short. Not clear if that was an attempted bouncer or one that went wrong. Either way it sat up nicely for Prior to rock back and pull fiercely over midwicket

Gone! This time Prior plays the big shot to the wrong ball. Munaf pitches one just outside the off stump and it wobbles in the air, not really swinging or shaping one way or the other. It does just enough to beat the bat of Prior who has had an almighty pull across the line. He closes the face of the bat just a touch too early and the ball spears off the edge towards the off side. Piyush Chawla calls for the catch and settles under it, judging it well and holding onto it as he tumbles backwards. That's the first England wicket gone.
fullish and on the off, it's Cook on strike as the batsmen crossed over while the Prior catch was being taken. Bell waits at the non-striker's end as Cook jabs the ball to point
fullish and outside the off, Cook leans into the line of the ball and eases it throuh cover. The timing and placement are good and the outfield is quick. More easy runs to the total ...
Fullish, on the pads, clipped to the leg side. Single stolen and Ian Bell gets on strike
short of a good length and on the stumps, just a hint of swing in to Bell who moves across his stumps and works the ball through square-leg for a single
just short of a length and on the off, Cook plays it to the on side and once again there's an easy single on offer as an Indian fielder gets to the ball pretty slowly
RP comes around the stumps. A hint of swing in to Bell. Short of a good length, played down towards point
short of a driving length and outside the off, Bell stands tall and defends the ball back down the pitch with a dead straight bat
once again just short of a length and the ball comes in from outside the off, both with the arm and through a touch of swing, defended back down the pitch
Short of a good length and on the stumps, played back down the pitch to the bowler
Cook takes another easy single, just pushing to mid-off and running through. This isn't great fielding inside the circle
fullish and on the off stump, played back down the pitch with a slightly angled bat
short of a good length and outside the off stump, played down to third-man
full and on the off stump, driven to cover, no chance of a run on that occasion
Yet another no-ball. Played down to the off side
fullish and outside the off, floated through, not even 125 kmh that, defended back down the wicket to end the over and the players will have a short break for drinks
bowled quicker through the air on off stump, defended on the back foot
defended towards midwicket on the front foot
Powar flights it superbly outside off stump, Bell comes down the track, realises that he has been beaten by the flight and defends
driven to wide mid-on for the single
bowled quicker through the air on middle stump, Cook leans forward and blocks
Cook tries to play the sweep but doesn't connect well
Munaf drops short again on off stump, Bell moves back and across and tries to pull but doesn't time or place it well enough to beat midwicket
pushed back towards the bowler on the front foot
Bell moves down the track to a good length ball and defends towards the bowler
124 kmh, full delivery on off stump, Bell leans forward and drives to mid-on
another no-ball, poor discipline from Munaf, Bell uses the width outside off to cut towards Powar at third man
another one, poor poor stuff from Munaf, he bowled five in the last game and he's already bowled four here, Cook plays it off his hips through midwicket
a half-volley on middle stump, Bell leans forward and drives firmly to mid-on
width offered outside off stump once again, Bell cuts past Yuvraj at point and the batsmen run a comfortable two to Powar at third man

Another one! Tossed up, looks gentle and inviting, Powar has put some revs on this ball though and it dips late. That's a beautifully flighted ball. Cook instinctively goes for the sweep shot. The ball does just enough to beat the bat and take the leading edge. It balloons straight up in the air for the simplest catch to Yuvraj Singh at short fine-leg. That's a classical offie's dismissal and Powar is over the moon as Cook is sent on his way
Pietersen is the new man in and Powar tosses another one up, Pietersen is forced to wait on the ball and defend watchfully
fuller and just a touch straighter, still plenty of air on the ball, clipped to the on side
flatter and quicker this time from Powar. He's not simply throwing everything up into the air. Pietersen adjusts and defends back down the pitch
this one is slower through the air and on the stumps, worked to the on side for a single that gets KP off the mark
once again on the stumps, once again flighted, quite slow through the air, defended to the on side. End of  quality over from Powar
Excellent ball first up. Pietersen gets his foot right down the ground and plays. The ball thuds into pad. Half shout for the lbw
another skidder on the stumps, no turn at all, Pietersen defends back down the pitch
There we go again. Chawla troubling KP with his googly here. Played at and missed and struck on the pad.
Bang! This one is picked off early. KP goes back in his crease nicely and pulls over midwicket for a boundary
tucked around the corner to fine-leg for a single
legbreak to end the over, pitches on off and turns away a touch, nothing too dramatic, cut late to the man at point
pushed through quicker and outside the off, this is the one that holds its line, really well bowled, KP feels for it outside off and misses, the ball slides past the outside edge to the keeper
flatter and on the stumps, defended carefully
another one on the stumps, tossed up a touch, worked to the leg side
slow, flighted, on the stumps, this one grips the surface a bit more and turns nicely to leg, a bit too much turn though and it's called a wide as it slips down leg side
defended back down the pitch
flighted and on the stumps, worked just wide of mid-on for a single that brings up the England 100!
End of another tidy Powar over. Just two from it. The spinners are putting the breaks on England once more here.
very full and on the stumps, defended to the on side at the last moment, not totally in control there from KP but the ball lands safely
tossed up, outside the off, the googly, chopped hard, the ball goes off the inside edge down to the leg side
fullish and outside the off, driven hard but equally well stopped at cover
defended carefully to the leg side
gentle, looping legbreak, that's a teasing ball, it dips and turns just enough to beat the bat
full and on the stumps, this one's the skidder, defended back down the pitch
Shot! Swept and swept really hard. The timing and placement are excellent as he takes the ball from just outside the off stump and sends it away to the square-leg fence!
full and on the off, defended
just drifting down the leg side, wide called
short and a bit of wifth, Bell rocks back and cuts that really well in front of the man at point. That is a good shot from Ian Bell
flat and on the pads, defended to the on side
well flighted and outside the off stump, a bit of turn here, Bell goes back and eases the ball through cover
on the off, turning a fair bit, the ball goes down leg and is called a wide
this one begins from outside the off and ends up on the stumps, defended back down the pitch with a straight bat
flat and on the middle and leg, worked away through midwicket for a run
swept and swept hard, this one looks destined to go for four but somehow RP Singh throws himself and saves a sure boundary
tossed up and outside the off, Bell shapes to cut and misses, through to the keeper
full and on the pads, eased through midwicket for a single

Here we go again! Piyush Chawls does KP in with the googly. That is a fine piece of bowling from this young legspinner to beat a batsman who plays spin so well. KP jumps down the track plays down the wrong line and is beaten all ends up. This time though the ball is missing the stumps and Mahendra Singh Dhoni pouches the ball cleanly and whips the bails off. That is a tidy bit of work behind the stumps to back up a clever bit of bowling. Big wicket for India!
flat and on the stumps, worked away through midwicket for a single
well flighted and outside the off, this is the drifter that holds its line. Collingwood defends with hard hands and the ball goes away through towards third-man off the outside edge
fuller and on the stumps, clipped to the on side
well flighted and outside the off stump, eased through cover for a single
again tossed up high into the air, on the stumps, defended watchfully back down the pitch
fullish and on the pads, worked away through the leg side for a single
tossed up, outside the off, big legbreak there, the batsman does not pick it and has a huge heave over the leg side, played at and missed
fullish and on the stumps, this one skids on, Collingwood defends carefully to the off side
just a bit of room and Collingwood can work the ball away through cover
cut away but straight to the man at point
eased through the off side for a single to end the over
flatter and on the stumps, worked away to deep backward square-leg for a single
straighter one outsode the off, Collingwood has a dart at it but misses it completely, through to the keeper
short and a bit of width outside the off stump, chopped down to first slip
full and on the stumps, driven to mid-on with a straight bat
just slipping down leg a touch, clipped away through aquare-leg for yet another single. It seems these two English batsmen have decided to do it in ones and twos against the spinners for the moment
fullish and on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
Biggie! Collingwood decides to go for the big shot and does it nicely. He comes down the pitch and chips teh ball magnificently over midwicket for a fine six! That is a quality shot
fullish and outside the off, driven to cover
short of a good length and outside the off, left well alone to the keeper
very full and very straight, driven inside out to cover
well flighted and on the off, worked away to the on side. Will the batsmen now go after Powar?
flatter and on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
this one is really really slow and tossed up. Excellent variation of pace and flight. The batsman is forced to be careful and defend.
quicker, flatter, on the off stump, chopped down towards third-man for a single
very full this time and hardly any chance for the ball to spin, dabbed down to long on for a single
once again flat and quickish to end the over, worked to the man at short midwicket
full and far outside the off stump, well tossed up, driven down to long-off for a single
down the pitch comes Collingwood again but he can't get hold of this one properly and drags the ball to mid-on
flatter and on the pads, tucked around the corner for a single
flighted and outside the off, it's the legbreak, Bell plays the reverse sweep and misses
better shot from Bell, a conventional drive through cover, all along the ground, beats the man in the circle but there is cover in the deep
another attempted reverse sweep, this one also fails, struck on the pad, Chawla smiles ruefully to himself at the end of the over
short to begin with, plenty of time for Bell to go back and pull through midwicket
on the pads, lapped down towards fine-leg for a single
very full and outside the off, a full-toss, punched back down the pitch, Yuvraj fields

Collingwood sweeps again and misses! The ball pitches on the stumps, straightens and hits the pad. That is very, very close and somehow Mark Benson thinks it's not out. Collingwood very lucky to get away with that
just short of a driving length and outside the off, chopped down hard but Yuvraj is at short third-man for that
Shot! Bell goes for the big hit and connects beautifully. That sails high, wide and handsome over midwicket for six. Bell has been really positive against India's spinners
full and on the off, Chawla coming round the wicket, defended with an angled bat
worked away to the on side
this time there's a run on offer as the ball is played down to Munaf Patel on the fence at deep backward square-leg
short and just a bit of width, driven inside out through cover, Tendulkar misfields and concedes an extra run
flat and on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
worked to the leg side
clipped away to the off side but no chance of a run
Collingwood eases into this one and drives well to the deep at cover-point for a single
another flat, quick one from Yuvraj that is missed and raps the pad. Benson turns it down even before the bowler can complete his appeal and that's the end of the over
too full, too easy for Collingwood, a gentle loosener outside the off, Collingwood times it back past the bowler for a boundary. Welcome back to the bowling crease, Zaheer Khan
short of a good length, angled in to the batsman from round the stumps, clipped away down to the leg side for a single
short of a good length, extra bounce from Zaheer on that occasion, Collingwood is squared up a touch and the ball goes away off the outside edge towards third man
just short of a length and on the pads, clipped away through square-leg for a single
again reasonably full and on the stumps, played and missed, rapped on the pad
well flighted and outside the off stump, driven inside out into the deep for a single
flat and on the pads, paddled just around the corner for a single
full and outside the off stump, eased down to long on for a single
tossed up a touch extra, seized upon by the batsman and driven through cover, easy single
short of a length and on the pads, flicked away to the on side
slightly fuller and on the pads, worked away down to fine-leg, Munaf Patel dives and fields on the ropes
short of a good length and outside the off, slanted away from the right-handed batsman, jammed down to third-man
short of a good length and outside the off, Collingwood plays a good short-arm jab in front of midwicket, Ramesh Powar runs around and fields, but the batsmen go through for a second
tossed up and on the pads, flicked down towards fine-leg for a single

well flighted and outside the off, Collingwood sees it early and plays the reverse sweep really well. The timing and placement are excellent and once the fielder in the circle is beaten it's four all the way!
played back to the bowler
this one's just slipping down leg and a sweep manages to help the ball on its way to fine-leg
fullish and on the pads, clipped away and the batsmen are off. Excellent running allows them to get back for a second run
tossed up and outside the off stump, driven at, the ball goes off the inside edge down towards short fine-leg
fuller and outside the off, eased past the infield for a single
speared in a bit on the pads, clipped away through the on side for a single

another one is worked through the on side and this brings up yet another critical half-century from Ian Bell. Consistency, postivity, clean strokeplay, we've seen it all from Bell so far. Now he needs to go on
eased to long off
fuller, quicker and on the stumps, defended back to the bowler, who fields in his followthrough
well flighted and outside the off, yet another reverse sweep, once again hit well enough to beat the man at short third-man, not a four this time
this time the conventional sweep as the ball is drifting onto pad, down to Yuvraj at short fine-leg
on the pads, sweep played, the ball balloons up in the air as it's gone off the edge, Yuvraj runs back at short fine-leg and throws himself full-length but the ball just eludes him

Gone! And Collingwood seems determined here to take his chances and this one doesn't come off. He plays the reverse sweep, does not middle the ball. The ball has done just enough to beat the middle of the bat, take the edge and loop up towards short third-man. Robin Uthappa, the substitute fielder is the man on the spot and he has no trouble settling under the catch. End of a good but slightly frenetic innings from England's captain
Full and on the stumps, paddled round the corner
flicked away towards square-leg for a couple of runs
flighted delivery on off and middle stump, Shah leans across and flicks behind square for one
Bell gets beaten by the flight and plays the flick too early, he gets an outside edge to short third man
pushed to mid-on for  a single
played off the pads towards midwicket
driven through covers for a single which brings up England's 200
another single to square leg to end the over, five off it
bowled quicker and flatter on middle and off stump, played with an open face to short third man
drifts on to middle and leg stump, Shah flicks off his pads to long leg
flighted delivery on off stump, Shah leans forward and tries to flick but misses
full delivery on off and middle stump, Shah moves forward and across and drives through wide mid-on
played off the pads behind square leg for a single
drifts on to leg stump once again but Bell flicks straight to Yuvraj at short fine leg
flicked off the pads to deep midwicket
defended with soft hands towards cover point for a single, Dhoni runs across and collects
lofted down to long-on for one more
flicked off the pads behind square for a single
a touch too short on off and middle stump, Bell moves on to the back foot and drives to long-on
a stumping opportunity goes abegging, Shah came down the track and Yuvraj bowls it quicker and yorks Shah who misses the ball completely, Dhoni can't collect it and Shah scrambles to make his ground
Full-toss outside the off, flat-batted through midwicket
eased away through cover, one for the throw and the batsmen easily come back back for the second
slightly short and outside the off stump, cut away in front of square, Ganguly is the sweeper on the off-side fence and two more runs result
Chawla comes round the stumps and cramps Bell for room. Down the track and driven to the bowler
It's Bell's turn to try the reverse sweep. Not too well hit, the ball bobs away to the off side
Shah plays the conventional sweep to a ball pitched on the stumps and gets a single to keep the strike
Bang! That is a biggie! Shah comes down the pitch, Yuvraj tries to fire the ball in full and ends up sending down a full-toss. It's creamed baseball style over midwicket for six

Very fast, very straight, that one is a rocket from Yuvraj Singh. He;s out-thought Shah comepletely here. Shah was moving around in his crease and trying to give himself some room to free his arms and clear the infield. All he ended up doing was giving Yuvraj a good look at the three stumps. Once he had that Yuvraj nailed Shah with a really quick ball that pretty much uprooted the leg stump. That was a clever bit of bowling from the part-time left-arm spinner!
very full, very flat, straight, sweep played down towards fine-leg
this one is slightly slower and is played down towards midwicket with a straight bat
slower and on the off, this is floated through a bit more, eased back past the bowler towards long-off for a single
full and on the stumps, driven inside out towards cover, a bit of a misfield and the batsmen can pick up a single
flat and on the stumps, defensive shot played and missed
full and on the pads, clipped away through the on side for a single, Chawla running through his deliveries really quickly here

Down the track and there she goes! Bell comes down the pitch in fine style, giving himself some room and getting to the pitch of the ball. Once he's there a clean swing of the bat sends the ball into the stands straight back over the bowler's head. That is a quality shot
once again the sweep, the ball goes down to the man at short fine-leg
short of a good length, from round the stumps, coming in with the arm, Bopara chops hard at it and gets it away fine. Third-man runs around but just can't cut that off
A bit of width and once more the cut, this time it's square though and will be cut off by the fielder in the deep

Another one bites the dust! Bopara walks across his stumps and tries to play a cute dab to the leg side. It's a risky shot with the left-arm seamer coming around the stumps. The ball pitches, grips the surface a touch and straightens. The leading edge comes into play and the ball pops straight into Rahul Dravid's hands at short cover. Simple catch and yet another failure for Bopara
full and outside the off, eased through cover for a single, Stuart Broad off the mark straight away
just short of a good length and outside the off, Bell plays nicely inside out and through cover, two more runs
just short of a length and outside the off, Bell bunts the ball to the leg side for one and keeps the strike as the 250 comes up for England
low full-toss outside the off, played down to point with an angled bat
full and outside the off, that one is pacy too, Bell tries to make room and drive but misses the ball. A bit of needle here between Bell and Zaheer
a good yorker from Zaheer to follow up that quick ball, Bell is up to the task and digs it out well, a single results
just short of a good length and on the off, Broad squeezes the ball away down to third-man for a single that gives Bell the strike
fullish and outside the off, Bell gives himself a bit of room and drives inside out to cover

Zaheer goes for the yorker once more. It ends up as a low full-toss which Broad swats away to the on side. Ganguly fields in the deep and keeps the batsmen down to one. This means Broad keeps the strike and just four runs off the over, a good one from Zaheer
very full and a bit outside the off, just a hint of away movement there. Broad reaches for the ball but is a bit late on the shot and misses the ball completely. Through to the keeper

short of a good length and on the stumps, played down to mid-on for a quick single. Dinesh Karthik reaches the ball quickly but cannot pick up the ball cleanly. That might have been a good chance for the run out

fullish and on the stumps, Bell gives himself a bit of room and tries to drive inside out and loft the ball over cover. Unfortunately for Bell, who has played very well here once again, he just cannot get under the ball enough. The elevation is not there and Dinesh Karthik at cover has to move five paces to his right and take the catch. He gets both hands on the ball and tumbles a bit, making the catch look a bit more spectacular than it was. End of a quality knock from Bell, though and England are losing their way a bit here.

played away down to square-leg, the throw comes in, RP Singh collects and misses the stumps from about five feet! That's an incredibly bad bit of fielding from the bowler and what's more he gives away the overthrow
once again worked away to square-leg. No drama this time, though, just a single
short of a good length and on the stumps, clipped away to the on side for an easy single
short of a good length and on the off, Broad goes back and tries to punch the ball through cover. The ball goes off the splice towards cover

Bang! Broad comes to the party. Short of a length and outside the off. Broad moves forward well and square-drives beautifully ... the ball beats the diving point fielder and races away to the boundary
very full and on the stumps, good yorker, equally well dug out, a single as well
another yorker, again dug out, again a single scrambled. Zaheer fields off his bowling and has a shy at the stumps but misses
quick and quite full, just outside the off stump, Broad swings and misses, the ball sails through to the keeper. Good over from Zaheer. One left in the innings now.

That's the biggest of the lot! RP Singh bowls one perfectly in the slot and Chris Tremlett hits this with all he's got. He gives himself a bit of room and clears teh ropes, the stands and everything else by some way. That ball has gone a long distance. HUGE hit from Tremlett to start the final over
this time RP Singh bangs it in short for variation. Tremlett swings and misses but the bye is scampered nevertheless

short of a good length, angled in to the left-handed batsman, Broad has an almighty heave, he can't quite connect cleanly, the bat turns in his hand and one hand comes off the bat as the ball gets plenty of elevation but not nearly enough distance. Yuvraj Singh back-peddles at cover and settles under the swirler. Another England wicket falls as the innigns comes towards a close
short of a length, on the middle and leg, Tremlett pulls this away to backward square-leg, Ganguly fields but can't stop the batsmen from running a second
RP fires the yorker in this time, squeezed well out down to long-on for a couple more
short of a length, really bad length to bowl at this time of the innings, Tremlett sees it early and pulls the ball strongly to the midwicket fence. That is a bold stroke to end the innings

inn2.comm: Excellent yorker to start with. Ganguly is up to the task and digs the ball out well. Broad is bang on target to begin with.
fullish once more and on the stumps, Ganguly comes forward to drive and the ball goes off a thickish outside edge to the leg side
back of a length this time and a bit of width outside the off, played down to point with a characteristically angled bat
just short of a good length and a bit of width outside the off stump, punched off the back foot to cover. Right off the meat of the bat that
overpitched and outside the off stump, once again hit very cleanly, pleasing cover drive but straight to the fielder
just short of a length and outside the off, eased to cover. Excellent start from Stuart Broad. It's a maiden to begin with.
fullish and outside the off, Tendulkar tries to work the ball to on, gets a leading edge towards point and gets off the mark right away
short of a good length and outside the off, angling away from the left-handed batsman, off the inside edge back down the pitch
a bit of extra pace, a bit of extra bounce, slanting away from the left-handed Ganguly who flashes and misses outside the off stump
decent pace, a very good length, on the stumps, punched to cover with a straight bat
just short of a full length, outside the off, Ganguly drives without moving to off too much, the ball goes uppishly but falls short of Collingwood at point who fields well
dragged back a bit this time, on the stumps, this one climbs quickly on Ganguly who is squared up but adjusts well enough and defends the ball back down the pitch
very full and on the stumps, clipped away down to the on side, Tendulkar wants the single but is sent back by Ganguly
short of a good length and outside the off stump, this one pitches and slants in a fair bit, Tendulkar watches carefully and leaves the ball alone
full and outside the off, Tendulkar drives nicely and beats the man at cover, there's one, they think about a second, but with this pair it's not on
very full and very straight, Ganguly gets behind the line of the ball but can only poke it defensively back to the bowler
short of a driving length and outside the off, Ganguly drives with an angled bat and the  ball goes off a thick inside edge down towards fine-leg

a bit too full and too straight - Anderson striving for swing here - Ganguly gets nicely in line and plays a trademark straight drive, that is a beautiful shot for four that breaks the shackles a little bit

And another! Ganguly pulls out yet another gorgeous drive. The bat comes down dead straight and meets a full ball just outside the off. The ball speeds away, beats mid-off and races away for four. Top shot!
A bit of width, just short of a length, and that's three in three balls. Ganguly gets into great position and square-drives that magnificently past point. No chance for the fielders there!
fullish and on the stumps, defended back down the pitch to the bowler
short of a driving length, outside the off stump, played down to point with an angled bat

short one banged in, Ganguly goes for the pull, he doesn't connect too well but there's enough bat on the ball to take it over Ravi Bopara at square-leg. The ball dribbles away for four to end an excellent over for India
full and on the stumps, Tendulkar walks across in what has become a favourite shot for him and clips the ball off his pads to deep backward square-leg
short of a driving length and outside the off, Ganguly leans into the line of the ball and drives to cover

Cracking shot from Ganguly once more. The ball is short of a length and outside the off. Ganguly waits on the ball perfectly and at the last possible moment opens the face of the bat and times the ball away magnificently past point. Tremlett dives on the ropes but can't get to it
short of a good length and on the off, defended away to the off side
short of a driving length and outside the off, another cracking shot from Ganguly square of the wicket on the off side, this time straight to the man at point though
fullish and outside the off stump, Ganguly opens the face of the bat and runs the ball towards point
full, straight and decent pace, Tendulkar waits on the ball and clips the ball to the leg side for yet another quick single
short of a length and outside the off, Ganguly moves back and across and pushes the ball just past the fielder at mid-off for a single
good-length ball on the off, Tendulkar punches the ball to the off side and there's no chance of a single
short of a good length, very straight, on the stumps, Tendulkar comes across his stumps and looks to work the ball to the leg side. The batsman misses and the ball hits pad
another little dab to the on side off a ball that is on the stumps, Tendulkar is favouring that shot for the single even as Ganguly is hitting all the fours
back of a length, slipping down leg, good bounce, the extra pace surprises Tendulkar a bit as he jabs the ball away towards square-leg
short of a good length and on the off, Ganguly stays on the crease and drives to cover, no chance of a single there
another very good ball. On the off stump, good pace and carry, Ganguly has to wait on the ball and defend towards to the off side
short of a good length and on the pads, Ganguly moves to off this time and works the ball to leg off the thigh pad but there's no chance of a run
another one that is very straight and this time Ganguly manages to work it wide of the fielder at midwicket and picks up a single

short of a good length, outside the off, Tendulkar jumps into position really early and punches off the back foot, the ball screams away by Alastair Cook fields magnificently at a short point position
fullish and outside the off, just a hint of swing in, Tendulkar judges well and leaves the ball alone to the keeper
short of a good length, one the stumps, Ganguly watches the ball carefull and defends back down the pitch
back of a length and on the off, slanting away from the left-handed Ganguly, the ball is punched down to point
very full this time and a shade outside the off, Anderson is looking for late swing here, Ganguly drives but straight to the fielder at mid-off
another one is pushed to mid-off. The bowler is bowling really well to his field here, keeping Ganguly quiet
bouncer banged in for variation, it's quick and short, Ganguly wants nothing to do with that and ducks well under it
fuller and outside the off, squeezed down to point with an angled bat
just short of a driving length and outside the off, driven inside out through cover for a single
very full and on the off, attempted yorker, Ganguly watches the ball well and digs the ball out back down the pitch, Stuart Broad dives in his followthrough and fields
short ball banged in, Ganguly, once again, wants nothing to do with it and leaves the ball well alone

down the leg side, left well alone, and wide is called, Broad isn't massively happy and says something to the umpire. That bouncer may just have passed over the line of leg stump to be fair to the bowler
on the stumps, swatted away through the on side, good timing and there's some runs here
very full and on the stumps, Ganguly drives to mid-on but does not beat the fielder
short of a length, on the off, Ganguly plays well but cannot pierce the cordon at point. There are three fielders there within a few yards of each other just to plug that gap
short of a good length and on the off stump, Tendulkar gets right behind the line of the ball and plays back to the bowler with a straight bat
full and on the off, Tendulkar moves across very quickly, decisive footwork here, but the shot offered is a defensive one back down the pitch
just a touch outside the off stump, short of a full length, Tendulkar opens the face of the bat and runs the ball to point
Shot! Where did that come from? Tendulkar sees the short one very very early and plays a magnificent pull short over midwicket. That is a bold shot and sends a clear message to the bowler
fuller and on the stumps, Tendulkar settles for a defensive push back down the pitch on this occasion

The sucker punch! Anderson bangs one in short of a length and outside the off. The ball climbs on Sachin Tendulkar as he shapes to cut. As the ball reaches the bat Tendulkar seems to be in two minds over whether to try and keep the ball down or uppercut it over point. In the end he does neither and slaps the ball straight to the man at point. Paul Collingwood settles under the simple catch and England have broken through. This is some quality bowling from England's fast bowlers first up
fullish and just outside the off stump, Ganguly eases the ball through the off side
fullish and quite straight, worked to the on side, Karthik still off strike
full and outside the off stump, Ganguly eases the ball towards mid-off, an excellent diving stop saves a boundary but the batsmen can pinch a single
short one welcomes Karthik to the crease. It's well directed and follows the batsman as he sways out of the way

And another one bites the dust. It's almost an action replay of the the Tendulkar dismissal. This time it's Stuart Broad with the short ball outside the off stump. Karthik sees it and gently, ever so gently, guides the ball to Alastair Cook in the off side. That is a soft dismissal if there ever was one, and Karthik fails to make use of the chance he has been afforded, being promoted to No. 3. England are in business here!
fullish, on the off, Dravid comes across and defends ever so watchfully. End of a successful over for England.
fullish and on the stumps, Ganguly drives back down the pitch. The bowler bends low and fields in his follow-through.
short of a good length and outside the off, Ganguly slaps that one through cover, well almost through cover as Bopara dives well and fields, just the single
short of a good length and outside the off stump, defended very very carefully back down the pitch
very full and quite straight, Dravid falls across a bit as he flicks to on, the ball goes straight to the man at short midwicket
very full once more and on the stumps, again Dravid falls over and flicks to midwicket. Again no chance of a run. England really have taken control at the moment
short of a driving length and outside the off stump, Dravid defends to the off side with an angled bat, no chance of a run and the dot balls are just adding up for India here
short of a good length and outside the off, punched to cover, no run once again

fullish and outside the off, Ganguly waits on the ball and drives very well towards mid-off, that would have raced away for four if India were on the field, but Pietersen dives hard and stops the ball
short of a good length and outside the off, Dravid chops and chops hard but can't beat the man at cover
full and on the stumps, this time Dravid whips the ball to the on side but once again England's fielders in the circle are buzzing about and there's no chance of a run
short of a good length and on the pads, Dravid moves across and flicks, the ball bobs away towards square-leg
full and on the off, driven just wide of the man at mid-off for a single to end the over
short of a good length and outside the off, Ganguly chops down to third-man for a single
short of a good length and on the pads, Dravid walks across and tries to flick, he misses and the ball goes off the pads down to the fine-leg fence for a boundary
full and on the stumps, Dravid drives the ball towards midwicket
Shot! Relief for Indian supporters after a period of strangulation. Full and on the stumps, Dravid flicks very late and times the ball impeccably through midwicket for a boundary
turned down to long-leg to bring up the Indian 50
just short of a good length and outside the off stump, punched down to point to end the over
short of a good length, on the off, Dravid watches the ball and despite it not being right up there for the drive, punches superbly back down the pitch. That is well placed and timed even better
short, a bit of width and Dravid pounces on the ball. He rocks back and cuts magnificently, beating the two fielders square of the wicket on the off side. That is a crisp shot for four
short of a good length and on the off, Dravid defends to off and wants a single but Ganguly sends him back
full and on the off stump, punched back hard to the bowler

BANG! And another excellent shot from Dravid. Again this is short and has a bit of width on it. Dravid goes on the back foot and creams this one through cover. That is a very well hit stroke through cover
short of a driving length and on the off stump, Dravid watches the ball carefully onto bat and defends to off
fullish and outside the off. Ganguly steers the ball down to third-man for a single

a bit too full and far too straight, this one is slipping down the leg side, Dravid clips this exquisitely through square-leg. That is bread and butter for Dravid and once again Tremlett getting a bit of tap from the Indian batsmen
short of a length and on the off, Dravid tries to work the ball to the on side but only manages to get the ball away off pad to the off side
full and on the off, Ganguly drives well but straight to the man at cover
short of a length and outside the off, chopped down but straight to the man at point, again a dot ball
fullish, outside the off, Ganguly gets this one away, another boundary! He opens the face of the bat at the last possible moment and gets the ball away through the vacant slip region for a boundary

And another one! That was an action replay of the previous shot. Fullish, outside the off, Ganguly just waits on the ball and steers it to the third-man fence, just opening the face of the bat and giving the ball direction
good length on off stump, draws Dravid forward, he pushes to mid-off and contemplates a single
Anderson cramps him for room, Dravid plays with soft hands towards cover and again sets off for a run and decides against it
drifting in towards the pads, Dravid plays an inside-out stroke and the ball rolls to the off side
good length outside off, Dravid dabs it to point
Anderson fires this one with more pace, pitches just outside off, Dravid defends to point
full in length, on leg stump, Dravid goes for the on drive and places it straight to mid-on
tossed up on off stump, Ganguly gets a big stride forward and pushes it towards mid-on, sets off for a single
flatter trajectory, not much spin, Dravid cuts to the off side
pushed in on middle, ganguly backs away and cuts to short cover
tossed on middle, defended back to Panesar
short of a length on off and middle, Dravid rocks back and flat-bats it past mid-on
tossed on leg, pushed to the on side
short of a good length, on the off, steered through cover for a single, Ganguly waited on the ball really nicely there
it's Dravid's turn to get the ball away for a single, whipping one from off through midwicket with ease
yet another single. on the pads of Ganguly and pushed down to the on side
full and on the stumps, driven to mid-on, no chance of a single on that occasion
short of a length and outside the off, cut played and missed, through to the keeper
short of a length, outside the off, played down towards point, Dravid charges down the pitch or a single, Ganguly sends him back, in comes the throw, Dravid's just made it back
this time there's a single and no confusion as the ball is worked well wide of the fielder
defended away to off
tossed up and outside the off, eased through cover with an angled bat
a bit of turn from outside the off, left alone to the keeper
short of a good length and outside the off, punched through cover for a single to end the over
fullish and outside the off side, steered down towards third-man with an angled bat
this time Dravid waits late enough to glide the ball past the fielder at short third-man to pick up a single
fullish and on the off, Ganguly jams the ball out towards point, the fielder pounces on the ball
another punch towards the off side, again a good bit of fielding in the infield and the single is saved
very straight, on the pads, played right back to the bowler
fullish and outside the off, Ganguly eases the ball through cover and calls "Two" by the time the ball is fielded in the deep this is revised to a more realistic one
tossed up, on the off, very full, defended carefully
short, wide, should have been put away but is chopped down to point
eased wide of mid-off for a single
tossed up, a bit short and a bit wide, Dravid goes right back in his crease and chops down past point, good shot but there's a man on the fence for the shot
fuller and on the off, defended to the off side for a quick single
very full and quite straight, Ganguly works it away past mid-on for a single to end the over
very slow slower ball on the stumps, off cutter at that, defended to the off side
short of a length and drifting down the leg side, clipped away for a single
another single worked away, this time through a glide down to third-man from Dravid and the Indian 100 comes up
quicker one from Collingwood, this is the seam-up delivery, a bit of width outside the off and quite full, Ganguly has a flash and misses
fullish and on the off, punched to cover where once again the ball is superbly fielded
another slower ball offcutter and Ganguly squirts it away to the on side
short of a good length, on the stumps, Dravid goes back and punches to the bowler
punched off the back foot but here again Dravid finds the fielder
a bit of width and Dravid can go back and ease the ball through cover point for a single
chopped down to point
fullish and outside the off, Ganguly comes forward in defence, the ball goes off pad to the off side and a leg-bye is stolen
short of a length and on the off, driven down the ground off the back foot for a single to end the over. The asking rate has now climbed past the seven-per-over mark
another offcutter from Collingwood, this one is almost flighted, outside the off, Dravid cuts and misses, through to the keeper
Bang! Rahul Dravid has had enough of Collingwood's offcutters. This one is smashed over midwicket. Dravid saw the ball early, lined up his area and teed off. That is a strong hit from Dravid
This is an even better shot than the previous one. Dravid waits very late on a straight ball and uses his wrists exquisitely to whip the ball backward of square
a single through square-leg and Dravid has now overtaken Ganguly
full and outside the off, eased to mid-off
just a bit of width and a touch short, Dravid goes back very quickly and punches through cover to bring up his half-century
very full and on the stumps, coming in to the left-handed Ganguly, worked to midwicket
Ganguly gets this one away down towards third-man and now he reaches his half-century
once again loopy and on the stumps, Ganguly comes forward and defends with bat close to pad
a bit of width outside the off and Ganguly chops past point for a single
pushed to mid-on, no chance of a single there
fullish and on the off, eased down towards the off side
short of a driving length and on the off, played down towards mid-off, again no chance of a single
dabbed away to the off side with soft hands and a surprise quick single
another very slow offcutter - Collingwood may as well be bowling offspin here - Dravid works the ball down towards third-man
full and quite straight, played back down the pitch to the bowler
worked away to the on side and that's the end of yet another fairly quiet over from Collingwood
very full and quite straight, Dravid tries to work the ball to the leg side and misses, loud shout for the lbw, not given, perhaps going down leg
fullish and outside the off, driven inside out through cover
A Ganguly classic! Down the track and lofted effortlessly. That's how Ganguly likes to play the left-arm spinners ... Panesar getting some treatment here
driven inside out but straight to cover
fullish and on the off, defended away to the leg side to end the over
short of a good length and outside the off, Ganguly pretends to back away to leg and walks back into his stumps and drives through cover
slower one on the off, driven towards cover, slightly uppish but safe enough
full and fairly straight, defended to cover
fullish and outside the off, swatted away with one hand down to long off, that single takes Ganguly to 11000 runs in ODI cricket
full and outside the off, Dravid plays a flashing drive and the ball goes off a thick inside edge down towards fine-leg
cheeky lap sweep from Dravid, the ball goes down to fine-leg and a single is sauntered
short of a length and outside the off, Dravid opens the face of the bat and runs the ball down to third-man
Tremlett gets the treatment once more as the 100 partnership comes up with a cracking drive through cover. Tremlett's getting some serious tap every time he comes on to bowl
short one - quite predictable really - and Ganguly leaves the ball well alone to the keeper
just short of a length and on the off, Ganguly goes back and across and jabs the ball towards point for a single

Gone! That's the big one! Paul Collingwood won't mind the runs Tremlett has given away as he's come up with the big wicket here. The ball was pitched just short of a driving length and in that zone a shade outside the off stump. Dravid went for the drive but with a slightly angled bat. A thick inside edge and the ball went right back into the stumps, giving Tremlett his first chance to celebrate all innings! That's a huge wicket and one India really did not want to lose at this stage
Suddenly Tremlett finds an extra yard of pace as Yuvraj feels for one outside the off stump first up. Play and a miss.
short of a length and on the stumps, worked to the on side
fullish and on the stumps, Ganguly drives the ball down to long-off for a single
fullish and on the pads, Yuvraj whips that around square for a quick single
back of a length and outside the off, driven off the back foot through cover
short of a good length and outside the off, Yuvraj goes back and clubs that, pull shot played but not timed too well
played back down to the bowler who fields in his followthrough. This could be a critical phase in the game for India. One quick wicket and England will be in control
eased down to mid-off
banged in just short of a length, Yuvraj doesn't quite have a measure of the pace of this pitch yet, he ducks under the ball and lets it go through to the keeper
fuller and outside the off, driven inside out through cover point for a single
Down the pitch and bang! Ganguly charges down the pitch to Tremlett and flat-bats the ball straight back over mid-off. There's no-one in the  deep and the ball bounces away for four

And another big one for Tremlett! Just after he was carted away with disdain he strikes back. Ganguly opens the face of the bat to a shortish ball outside the off in an attempt to run the ball to third-man. There's a thick edge and Matt Prior throws himself to his left and catches the ball. Tremlett allows himself a big smile and why not? He's just got England another breakthrough that could well put them in charge of this match
short of a good length and on the off, Dhoni defends a touch awkwardly to the off side
slower ball, off-cutter, Yuvraj feels for it outside off and misses, clever bowling this from Paul Collingwood
Too full, outside the off and that is hit as hard as anything has been all day. Glorious cover drive from Yuvraj. He picked his spot and hit the ball incredibly hard on that occasion
on the leg stump, defended at, Yuvraj is rapped on the pad, loud shot for the lbw
on the legs once more, whipped away down to fine-leg for a single
dibbly offcutter on the stumps, Dhoni punches towards mid-off and scampers the single
just short of a driving length and outside the off, driven inside out and through cover
fullish and on the stumps, punched through midwicket, Monty Panesar gives chase and pulls the ball in just before the ropes ...
short of a good length and on the off, Dhoni punches off the back foot to cover
back of a length and slipping down leg, Dhoni stands tall and drops the ball to his feet, once again these two batsmen hare off for a quick single
just short of a length and outside the off, Yuvraj watches the ball carefully and leaves it well alone to the keeper
short of a good length, outside the off, Yuvraj picks up the length very very early and pulls it magnificently in front of square. That is a powerful, confident hit and again Tremlett is sent packing
full and straight, driven this time, powerfully struck bit won't beat Panesar at long-on
full-toss on leg stump, punched away back past the bowler down to long-on where once again Panesar has to clean up
A bit too much width, a loosener, Yuvraj sees it perfectly well and crashes a square-cut through point. Bopara welcomed to the crease in rather rude fashion
clipped through the on side
short of a good length and on the stumps, driven back down the pitch to the bowler
short of a driving length and outside the off, Dhoni is squared up by that one and misses the ball. Just past the outside edge to the keeper
fullish and on the pads, worked away down to deep fine-leg for a single
back of a length and outside the off, thumped hard but to the man at short cover
short of a driving length, outside the off, Yuvraj thinks about giving that one a whack but changes his mind at the last moment and leaves it alone
fuller and on the stumps, squirted away past cover for a single
fullish and on the pads, worked away through the on side, frantic running from Dhoni and Yuvraj and there's two more to the total
short of a good length and outside the off, Dhoni jabs hard, off the inside edge down to the keeper just past the stumps
short of a good length and outside the off, Dhoni goes back and punches to cover, no chance of a run that time
very full and quite straight, Dhoni drives down to long-off and jogs a single to end the over
short of a good length and outside the off, punched away towards the off side for a single to get this Bopara over going
slower ball, on the stumps, just about squirted away to the leg side and a single is somehow scampered
short of a length and outside the off stump, pulled to the on side but not past the man at midwicket
short of a length and outside the off, another really powerful pull shot. That is a cracking shot. The ball flies off the blade but is brilliantly stopped by short midwicket
short of a driving length and outside the off, Yuvraj goes back and across and punches down to long-on
short of a good length and outside the off, driven fiercely on the up but straight to mid-off
short of a driving length and cramping Dhoni for room on the off stump, driven away a bit awkwardly but efficiently enough for a single
good-length ball on the stumps, punched back down the pitch to the bowler
shot of a good length and on the off, Yuvraj tries to work the ball to the leg side, off the leading edge towards cover
short of a length and on the pads, swatted down to fine-leg for a single
short one banged in, it's quite high and Dhoni leaves it alone and it's called a wide
short of a length and on the off, Dhoni slaps the ball away through square-leg and once again hard running gets the batsmen two

Gone! Short, a bit of width, Dhoni's eyes light up and he gets in really good position to play the cut shot. Once in position Dhoni gives it all he's got, thrashing the ball really hard. But, just like Tendulkar earlier in the day, it's neither kept down nor hit high up and travels to Paul Collingwood at a comfortable catching height, even if at scorching pace. Collingwood latches on to the chance - he's not like to miss these - and the bowling change has worked. Huge wicket for England with India still needing 92
short of a good length and outside the off, Powar sways out of the way of that one
another short one, this one is quicker and better directed, coming in towards the body of Powar who sways out of the way and lets the ball go through to the keeper
a bit of width this time, still short, Powar slaps the ball down towards point and takes a single to give the strike to Yuvraj, the last recognised batsman
fierce yorker from Anderson to end the over! Yuvraj just about manages to get his feet out of the way and jam the bat down in time
very full and on the stumps, Powar watches the ball carefully and knocks it sensibly to mid-on. Will he give Yuvraj the strike or go for the big one himself?
short of a length and on the off, jammed down to the off side for a single
very full and on the off, Tremlett searching for the yorker, Yuvraj digs the ball out to the off side
short of a good length and on the off, played down to mid-off with a straight bat
Cracker! A touch of width outside the off and Yuvraj drives that with immense power. One bounce and over the ropes at long-off. That is a handsome shot
A single squeezed through cover and Yuvraj will keep the strike
slow off-cutter on the stumps, driven down the pitch to long-off for a single
just short of a length and Powar goes for the big hit, the ball goes up in the air but somehow does not carry to long-on ... risky shot that
short of a length, a bit straight, Yuvraj gets in position quickly and pulls to square-leg for a single that brings up India's 200
fuller and on the off, Powar walks across his stumps and bunts the ball to the leg side, straight to the man at short midwicket
slower ball just outside the off, it's an off-cutter, steered to short third-man
very full and on the pads, Powar whips this one through square-leg to take a single that will give him the strike for the next over with the required rate now well past the eight-per-over mark
tossed up and outside the off, steered away past the keeper
flat and on the pads, flick played and missed, half a shout for lbw
tossed up, on the off, a bit of turn, Yuvraj defends carefully to the on side
And there he goes! Yuvraj Singh shimmies down the pitch a touch, gets down on one knee and clouts the ball into the stands over midwicket. That is a big hit for maximum
flat and fast, Yuvraj plays and misses
flicked down to long-on for a single, again Powar keeps the strike with a single off the last ball of an over. This is a bit hard to understand from India

Got him! Another wicket falls to a short ball! It's outside the off, sits up and could have been hit anywhere really. What Powar does though, instead of taking the single and giving the strike to Yuvraj, is go for glory himself. The result is a hard club to midwicket where Ian Bell latches onto a sharp catch and makes it that much harder for India. Not very intelligent batting this from Powar.
short of a length once more, decent pace now from Collingwood, Chawla tucks the ball to the leg side and scampers a single
well down the leg side, Yuvraj plays a big shot and misses, won't matter much, though, wide called
slower ball on the off stump, Yuvraj shows some respect and defends the ball back down the pitch
on the pads, Yuvraj paddles the ball hard down to Panesar at short fine-leg, Chawla screams across for the single. A direct hit and Chawla was gone, but Panesar's throw just missed

Yet another soft dismissal and India get one more wicket closer to defeat in this match. Piyush Chawla gets a fullish ball outside the off and only manages to move into line and uppishly scoop the ball to the off side. Once again it's Ian Bell who is prowling in the area and takes a good catch diving forward. That's the 7th Indian wicket gone
short of a length and outside the off, Zaheer defends carefully to the off side
full and on the off, Yuvraj drives hard just past the man at mid-off for a single
pushed through a bit quicker outside the off, Zaheer leans forward in defence and misses, the ball spins and beats the outsude edge

Gone! Zaheer does the unthinkable. He plays a defensive shot down to the off side and takes a couple of steps down the pitch. Yuvraj responds immediately and sprints down the pitch. Just as soon as he sees Yuvraj coming Zaheer changes his mind and decides he doesn't want the run. By now Yuvraj has come half way down the pitch and has little chance of getting back. Ian Bell swoops down on the ball and returns it to Monty Panesar who whips the bails off and Yuvraj is well short of his crease. That should be the end of that as far as India's challenge is concerned ....
Zaheer goes for the big one and connects cleanly. Lofted over the infield and four to Zaheer and India. That might make him feel a bit better but you can bet he'll still be thinking of the run out
defended back down to the off side
Broad is back in the attack and bangs the ball in short first up. RP Singh stands on his toes and defends the ball down to his feet somewhat awkwardly
short of a length and outside the off, RP has a wild swing at that. Plenty of breeze but no connection, the ball goes through to the keeper
another one in the slot, this time RP connects with a smear over midwicket
another agricultural across-the-line heave from RP. This time the ball goes off the edge over the wicketkeeper and down towards fine-leg
short of a good length and outside the off, chopped away towards point
short and a bit of width, Zaheer plays an expansive cut shot but it's just a single as the ball bounces down to the man on the ropes at point
tossed up and outside the off, aheer goes for a mighty heave and misses
short of a good length and outside the off, chopped away past cover for a single
slower through the air, a bit more height in the loop and subsequently more turn as RP slashes and missed outside off
slogged acoss to the on side for a couple more
another play and a miss outside the off, it's only a matter of time here ...
full and quite straight, scythed down back past the bowler to long-off
this is getting a bit embarrassing for India now ... another clueless heave and a miss as the ball goes through to the keeper
outside the off, pretty full, RP aims at midwicket and has a go but is nowhere near the ball
slower ball this time, and still RP can't make contact ... another ball goes through to the keeper amid some series heaving of the bat but no contact
fullish and on the stumps, RP hits this one, a little bit, chipped down to mid-off for a single
Zaheer goes one better over RP. He makes clean contact with a short ball and picks up a boundary at midwicket
full and straight, the attempted yorker, driven to midwicket for a single

Finally one is on the stumps. Panesar tosses the ball up, it dips nicely, pitches and straightens after pitching. Zaheer has a blind swipe across the line, trying to deposit the ball out of the ground perhaps, but misses. The ball heads dead straight and pegs the off stump back. Just one wicket now and England will have a 2-1 lead in this series
tossed up and on the off, Munaf has a heave and sends the ball towards midwicket
on the off and quite flat, jammed down towards point
short and a bit of width, cut down to point
very full and quite straight, played at and missed, off the pads to the leg side
flat and on the off, swiped away down to midwicket

Full, straight, fast and deadly. That's the finish you want from a fast bowler when he's bowling to a regulation No. 11. Anderson unveils the leg-stump yorker and Munaf has no answer. The timber is rattled and it's all over as England take this game by 42 runs
